reference.shortdesc: The linkpool element contain a link pool. A link pool is a group of links; the order of the links in the output is determined by the processor.

section.title: Usage information
section.p: Attributes that are set on the linkpool element cascade to the contained links.

section.title: Rendering expectations
section.p: The order in which links are rendered is processor-specific. A processor might order links based on role or type. A processor might move or remove links based on the context; for example, prerequisite links might be rendered at the beginning of a Web page, or links to the next topic might be removed if the two topics are rendered on the same page in a PDF. Processors might automatically sort some links, while others are left ordered as authored.
